items.text: Water your snake plant when the top 2 inches of soil are dry. Snake plants are drought-tolerant and prefer to be underwatered rather than overwatered.
Snake plants prefer bright, indirect light but can tolerate low light conditions. Avoid direct sunlight which can burn the leaves.
Yellow leaves on snake plants usually indicate overwatering. Check soil moisture and reduce watering frequency.
Most houseplants prefer temperatures between 65-75Â°F. Avoid placing plants near heating vents or air conditioners.
Fertilize houseplants during the growing season (spring and summer) with a balanced liquid fertilizer diluted to half strength.
